alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Fayette (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 2:24PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL FAYETTE AND NORTHEASTERN CLINTON COUNTIES THROUGH 300 PM EDT... At 224 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Wilmington, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, pea size hail, and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Washington Court House, Wilmington, Sabina, Staunton, Milledgeville, Melvin, Lees Creek, Reesville, Bloomington, New Antioch and Jasper Mills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
